job_title: Direct Service Provider in Belmont, NC
pros: The clients, the joy of feeling that you are helping someone in need.
cons: Management. I feel that upper management does not care about the people who are actually doing the Hands-On work with the clients and who know the clients better than anyone else. Also I was there for 6 years most of which was full time but I had to go part-time my last year there because I was pregnant and was restricted for work. I wasn't notified of this ahead of time but once I took my medical leave which was exactly 4 days before I had my son, I was told that because I was part-time they could not hold my position but that I could come back and apply afterwards as they had me as a good employee. However when I tried to go back and get a job they refused to hire me back. I did get unemployment during the time that I was out of work but I still feel like it was kind of shady the way that they didn't let me know ahead of time what would happen. Also the pay wasn't good. After 6 years of working there with no write ups I left there making less than a dollar more than what I started out as. It's not all about the money which is why I stayed as long as I did but still we worked hard. and I know that there are people there that are still working very hard and they should be compensated for their hard work.
